      50             : /**
      51             :  * Returns true if the current thread is the ImageBrdigeChild's thread.
      52             :  *
      53             :  * Can be called from any thread.
      54             :  */
      55             : bool InImageBridgeChildThread();
      56             : 
      57             : /**
      58             :  * The ImageBridge protocol is meant to allow ImageContainers to forward images
      59             :  * directly to the compositor thread/process without using the main thread.
      60             :  *
      61             :  * ImageBridgeChild is a CompositableForwarder just like ShadowLayerForwarder.
      62             :  * This means it also does transactions with the compositor thread/process,
      63             :  * except that the transactions are restricted to operations on the Compositables
      64             :  * and cannot contain messages affecting layers directly.
      65             :  *
      66             :  * ImageBridgeChild is also a ISurfaceAllocator. It can be used to allocate or
      67             :  * deallocate data that is shared with the compositor. The main differerence
      68             :  * with other ISurfaceAllocators is that some of its overriden methods can be
      69             :  * invoked from any thread.
      70             :  *
      71             :  * There are three important phases in the ImageBridge protocol. These three steps
      72             :  * can do different things depending if (A) the ImageContainer uses ImageBridge
      73             :  * or (B) it does not use ImageBridge:
      74             :  *
      75             :  * - When an ImageContainer calls its method SetCurrentImage:
      76             :  *   - (A) The image is sent directly to the compositor process through the
      77             :  *   ImageBridge IPDL protocol.
      78             :  *   On the compositor side the image is stored in a global table that associates
      79             :  *   the image with an ID corresponding to the ImageContainer, and a composition is
      80             :  *   triggered.
      81             :  *   - (B) Since it does not have an ImageBridge, the image is not sent yet.
      82             :  *   instead the will be sent to the compositor during the next layer transaction
      83             :  *   (on the main thread).
      84             :  *
      85             :  * - During a Layer transaction:
      86             :  *   - (A) The ImageContainer uses ImageBridge. The image is already available to the
      87             :  *   compositor process because it has been sent with SetCurrentImage. Yet, the
      88             :  *   CompositableHost on the compositor side will needs the ID referring to the
      89             :  *   ImageContainer to access the Image. So during the Swap operation that happens
      90             :  *   in the transaction, we swap the container ID rather than the image data.
      91             :  *   - (B) Since the ImageContainer does not use ImageBridge, the image data is swaped.
      92             :  *
      93             :  * - During composition:
      94             :  *   - (A) The CompositableHost has an AsyncID, it looks up the ID in the 
      95             :  *   global table to see if there is an image. If there is no image, nothing is rendered.
      96             :  *   - (B) The CompositableHost has image data rather than an ID (meaning it is not
      97             :  *   using ImageBridge), then it just composites the image data normally.
      98             :  *
      99             :  * This means that there might be a possibility for the ImageBridge to send the first
     100             :  * frame before the first layer transaction that will pass the container ID to the
     101             :  * CompositableHost happens. In this (unlikely) case the layer is not composited
     102             :  * until the layer transaction happens. This means this scenario is not harmful.
     103             :  *
     104             :  * Since sending an image through imageBridge triggers compositing, the main thread is
     105             :  * not used at all (except for the very first transaction that provides the
     106             :  * CompositableHost with an AsyncID).
     107             :  */
     108             : class ImageBridgeChild final : public PImageBridgeChild
     109             :                              , public CompositableForwarder
     110             :                              , public TextureForwarder
     111             : {
